result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Robert Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Robert Thompson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Robert Thompson was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Douglas County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Programming as deemed appropriate by DOC

Pay as required by Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay as required will result in a civil judgment being entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Per Wis Stat- Funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason Robert Thompson

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Arraignment & Plea & Sentencing Hearing Held on 4/18/22

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
11:12 AM Defendant Jason Robert Thompson in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jason Robert Thompson.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Amended information was filed this morning adding count 3. State indicates defendant will plead to new count 3, with 18 months IC and 2 years ES, I&S consecutive to 19CF52, 19CF53 and 19CF29, 0 days credit. In 22CM63, 5 days jail with five days credit. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties to defendant.  Defendant pleads no contest to all counts.  Court informs defendant of rights given up by his plea. Defendant understands. Court finds defendant understands rights and waives those rights freely, voluntarily and knowingly. Court finds plea is made freely, voluntarily and knowingly.  Court accepts defendants plea and finds defendant guilty. No objection to factual basis. count 2 is dismissed in 22cm63 and counts 1 and 2 in 22CF83 are dismissed
Court orders in 22CM63, 5 days jail, 5 days credit, plus court costs. In 22CF83, 3 years 6 months fashioned at 18 months IC, 2 years ES, consecutive to 19CF52, 19CF53 and 19CF29, 0 credit. Mandatory court costs, DOC programming. No contact with victim. Eligible for substance abuse program.
Case recalled at 11:27 AM.  State withdraws request for no contact since he will be in custody.  Court indicates it is a condition of his extended supervision. Condition left as is for now. May submit stipulation at a later time if needed.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
9:28 AM Defendant Jason Robert Thompson in court, in custody. Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Jason Robert Thompson.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Rosenthal requests to have 22CM63 hearing removed from calendar and scheduled to the same date as this one.  Court reschedules 22CM63
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim 1 or her address, no use or possession of controlled substances or paraphernalia
Signed Order to Seal Identification Key

01:37 PM Defendant Jason Robert Thompson in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Jason Robert Thompson in custody.  Angela M Wilson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Att hoffman received complaint, not guilty to ct 2
State requests $5000 cash bail, no contact with victim 1, no drugs or paraph.. Lists prior criminal history.
Att Hoffman- long term resident, comes to court when ordered, can't post, is on a probation hold
Court orders $3000 cash bail, no contact with victim 1 or her address, no drugs or paraph.. Sets date
Defendant questions if other case is set with the same dates
Court- other case is a misd. case, runs a different track than a felony

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
